chart_description: This chart shows the number of eBPF load methods in use on the system. eBPF load methods are used to load eBPF programs into the kernel. A higher number of load methods may indicate a more complex configuration or heavier usage of eBPF.

dimension_descriptions.co-re: The number of load methods using the Co-RE (Compile Once - Run Everywhere) framework. The Co-RE framework enables eBPF programs to be compiled once and then run across multiple kernel versions and configurations.
dimension_descriptions.legacy: The number of load methods using the legacy method. This is the traditional method for loading eBPF programs and can require recompilation for each kernel version and configuration.
